item.title: 据说贝恩将吸引中国竞标者竞购价值 40 亿美元的数据中心
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，贝恩资本旗下 Chindata Group Holdings Ltd.拥有的中国数据中心业务引起了当地竞标者的兴趣，他们希望通过拓展该行业来利用人工智能的蓬勃发展。【原文：The China data center business owned by Bain Capital’s Chindata Group Holdings Ltd. has drawn interest from local bidders seeking to expand in the sector to tap a boom in artificial intelligence, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 印度市场受关税困扰，Reliance 年度投资者会议成为焦点
item.description: 在交易日开始之前，我们为您带来可能影响市场的重要新闻和事件摘要。今天我们关注【原文：Before the trading day starts we bring you a digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets. Today we look at:】

item.title: 日本赤泽称有望在行政命令颁布前访问美国
item.description: 日本最高贸易谈判代表赤泽亮世说，在特朗普政府发布降低对日关税的行政命令之前，他预计将至少再访问美国一次。【原文：Japan’s top trade negotiator Ryosei Akazawa says he expects to visit the US at least once more before the Trump administration issues an executive order to lower tariffs on Japan.】

item.title: 阿里巴巴和 JD.com 的交易为亚洲贷款市场注入强心针
item.description: 科技巨头阿里巴巴集团控股有限公司（Alibaba Group Holding Ltd.）和京东商城（JD.com）计划筹集数十亿美元的外汇资金，为亚太地区银团贷款市场注入了一股活力。【原文：Technology giants Alibaba Group Holding Ltd. and JD.com are adding a jolt of energy to the Asian-Pacific syndicated loan market with plans to raise billions of dollars in foreign currency.】

item.title: 卢拉授权针对特朗普关税的报复程序
item.description: 巴西副总统杰拉尔多-阿尔克明（Geraldo Alckmin）表示，巴西总统路易斯-伊纳西奥-卢拉-达席尔瓦（Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva）授权启动一项程序，对唐纳德-特朗普征收的 50%关税进行报复。【原文：Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva authorized the start of a process to retaliate against the 50% tariffs imposed by Donald Trump, Vice President Geraldo Alckmin said.】

item.title: 韩国预算增长 8.1%，在关税影响下促进经济增长
item.description: 韩国新一届自由派政府计划大幅增加年度预算，以重振受到美国关税、福利成本上升和人口老龄化（韩国是世界上出生率最低的国家之一）压力的经济。【原文：South Korea’s new liberal government plans a hefty expansion of its annual budget to revive an economy under pressure from US tariffs, rising welfare costs and an aging population with one of the world’s lowest birth rates.】

item.title: 韩国计划出售创纪录的 2026 年债券为李明博的预算提供资金
item.description: 韩国将在 2026 年发行创纪录的 232 万亿韩元（约合 1,672 亿美元）债券，为总统李在明的扩张性财政议程提供资金，自由派政府的支出将比今年增长 8.1%。【原文：South Korea will issue a record 232 trillion won ($167.2 billion) of bonds in 2026 to finance President Lee Jae Myung’s expansionary fiscal agenda, with the liberal government’s spending set to rise 8.1% from the current year.】

item.title: 日本就削减长期债券供应征求一级交易商意见
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，日本财务省已就进一步减少较长期限政府债券的发行量征求一级交易商的意见。【原文：Japan’s Ministry of Finance has asked primary dealers for their views on further reducing issuance of longer-maturity government bonds, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 泰国 450 亿美元基金认为黄金和股票将提高回报率
item.description: 泰国政府养老基金预计，黄金、大宗商品和全球股市的反弹将推动其回报率在今年上半年表现惨淡后回升。【原文：Thailand’s Government Pension Fund expects gold, commodities and a rally in global equities to drive a recovery in its returns after a dismal performance in the first half of the year.】

item.title: 菲律宾中央银行或降息或维持利率，关注经济和关税问题
item.description: 菲律宾央行行长伊莱-雷莫洛纳（Eli Remolona）表示，菲律宾央行今年要么按兵不动，要么再下调一次关键利率，具体取决于经济数据和美国关税的影响。【原文：The Philippine central bank will either stand pat or cut its key rate one more time this year, depending on economic data and the impact of US tariffs, according to Governor Eli Remolona.】

item.title: 软银出售日本今年最高票息的混合债券
item.description: 软银集团公司确定了 2,000 亿日元（13 亿美元）混合债券的条款，票面利率为 4.556%，超过了日本航空公司的永续次级债券，创下了今年国内发行的日元公司债券的最高票面利率。【原文：SoftBank Group Corp. set terms for a ¥200 billion ($1.3 billion) hybrid bond at a coupon of 4.556%, topping Japan Airlines Co.’s perpetual subordinated notes and setting the highest coupon for a domestically issued yen corporate bond this year.】

item.title: 中国国有银行向香港提出世茂法律挑战
item.description: 中国农业银行股份有限公司（Agricultural Bank Ltd.，简称 "中国农业银行"）的一个部门正在香港对拖欠债务的中国建筑商世茂集团控股有限公司（Shimao Group Holdings Ltd.）提起法律诉讼，以追讨约 10 亿元人民币（1.4 亿美元）的未偿债务。【原文：A unit of Agricultural Bank of China Ltd. is taking its legal challenge against defaulted Chinese builder Shimao Group Holdings Ltd. to Hong Kong as it seeks to recover about 1 billion yuan ($140 million) in unpaid debt.】

item.title: 印度出口商寻求拓展非洲市场以躲避 50%的美国关税
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普因南亚国家购买俄罗斯石油而对其征收全球最严厉的关税之一作为惩罚之后，印度企业正寻求扩大在非洲的生产，以便向美国出口。【原文：Indian businesses are looking to expand production in Africa for exporting to the US, after President Donald Trump hit the South Asian nation with one of the steepest levies globally as punishment for purchases of Russian oil.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利提示风险，高盛上调中国股票目标价
item.description: 由于宏观经济指标依然疲软，流动性推动的中国股市反弹正引发华尔街分析师对其可持续性的争论。【原文：A liquidity-driven rally in Chinese stocks is sparking debate among Wall Street analysts over its sustainability, as macroeconomic indicators remain weak.】

item.title: 交易员为通胀数据做好准备，黄金逼近历史纪录
item.description: 黄金连续一周上涨，使其更接近历史最高点，因为投资者在为通胀数据做准备，该数据可能被证明是美国今年货币宽松政策的关键。【原文：Gold headed for a consecutive weekly gain that’s pushed it closer to a record high, as investors braced for an inflation reading that may prove key to US monetary easing this year.】

item.title: 中国股市持续反弹，月成交额创历史新高
item.description: 中国股市本月的成交量将创下历史新高，这凸显了股市牛市的强劲势头，吸引了越来越多的投资者。【原文：China’s stock market is heading for a record turnover this month, underscoring the intensity of a bull run that’s bringing in more investors by the day.】

item.title: 卡特彼勒预计今年关税影响高达 18 亿美元
item.description: 卡特彼勒公司（Caterpillar Inc.【原文：Caterpillar Inc. is warning investors that it’s now expecting tariffs to have an impact of as much as $1.8 billion on the company this year, higher than its guidance in early August.】

item.title: 比亚迪投资者在财报发布前对股价的悲观情绪有所缓解
item.description: 近几个月来，比亚迪公司股价大幅下挫，但有迹象表明，随着这家中国电动汽车制造商准备在周五晚些时候发布业绩，投资者对它的看法正变得越来越积极。【原文：After BYD Co.’s dramatic stock plunge in recent months, signs are emerging that investors are getting more positive about the Chinese electric-vehicle maker as it prepares to release results later Friday.】

item.title: 俄罗斯交易让信实石油核心在年度盛会上成为焦点
item.description: 长期以来，信实工业有限公司的年度投资者聚会一直是印度财经日历上的红字日，股东们期待着雄心勃勃的目标、大胆的声明，以及难得一见的因商业头脑而备受赞誉的亿万富翁。【原文：Reliance Industries Ltd.’s annual investor gatherings have long been a red-letter day in the Indian financial calendar, with shareholders anticipating ambitious targets, bold statements and a rare sighting of a billionaire lauded for his business acumen.】

item.title: 日本央行继续加息，补贴导致东京通胀放缓
item.description: 在政府公用事业补贴的带动下，东京的通胀率大幅下降，但由于通胀率仍远高于日本央行的目标，决策者仍在进一步加息的道路上徘徊。【原文：Inflation in Tokyo eased sharply, led by government utility subsidies, while keeping policymakers on the path toward further interest-rate hikes as it still stayed well above the Bank of Japan’s target.】

item.title: 石油供应过剩的担忧和地缘政治成为主导，石油将出现月度下跌
item.description: 由于投资者担心石油供应过剩以及地缘政治紧张局势，包括美国领导的结束乌克兰战争的努力，石油价格走低，创下月度跌幅。【原文：Oil edged lower to head for a monthly loss, as investors weighed concerns about a looming glut along with geopolitical tensions, including US-led efforts to end the war in Ukraine.】

item.title: 林纳斯稀土公司 7.5 亿澳元出售后股票将复牌
item.description: 在澳大利亚亿万富翁吉娜-莱因哈特（Gina Rinehart）的支持下，Lynas 稀土有限公司（Lynas Rare Earths Ltd.）通过出售股票筹集了 7.5 亿澳元（4.88 亿美元）资金，以加快其扩张计划，预计该公司股票将于周五恢复交易。【原文：Shares of Lynas Rare Earths Ltd. are expected to resume trading Friday after the critical materials miner backed by Australian billionaire Gina Rinehart raised A$750 million ($488 million) in a stock sale to speed up its expansion plans.】

item.title: 莫迪将在重要访问期间确保与日本达成投资和供应协议
item.description: 印度总理纳伦德拉-莫迪（Narendra Modi）在为期两天的访日行程中有望获得日本超过 10 万亿日元（约合 680 亿美元）的投资承诺。【原文：Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi is expected to secure investment pledges from Japan of more than ¥10 trillion ($68 billion) during his two-day trip to the country, people familiar with the matter said, as he seeks to bolster the economy against soaring US tariffs.】

item.title: 中行财报前期权大涨，交易员押注波动率
item.description: 在周五晚些时候的财报发布之前，期权交易员们一直忙于对多家中国主要银行下注。【原文：Options traders have been busy placing bets on a number of major Chinese banks ahead of their earnings later Friday.】

item.title: 调查显示：英国公司不惧增税，计划增加招聘人数
item.description: 一项调查显示，尽管英国财政大臣雷切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）提出了增税政策，但越来越多的企业计划在未来一年中雇佣更多员工。【原文：UK business confidence rose this month to its highest in almost a decade, with an increased majority of firms planning to hire more staff in the coming year despite Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves’ tax hikes, a survey found.】

item.title: 智囊团称英国银行应向英国央行缴纳新的利润税
item.description: 英国财政大臣雷切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）可以通过对商业贷款机构征收暴利税，从纳税人手中收回他们在英格兰银行的存款利润，从而增加数十亿英镑的急需收入。【原文：UK Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves could raise billions of pounds of much-needed revenue by imposing a windfall tax on commercial lenders to recover the profits they are making from taxpayers on deposits held at the Bank of England.】

item.title: 泰国债券涨势或将降温，因为泰国政府已考虑削减 BOT，总理裁决迫在眉睫
item.description: 据基金经理称，由于进一步降息的前景几乎已被计入价格，泰国债券的涨势可能会枯竭。【原文：Thailand’s bond rally may run out of steam as prospects for further interest rate cuts are all but priced in, according to fund managers.】

item.title: 维珍澳大利亚公司称需求保持稳定，年度利润大幅增长
item.description: 维珍澳大利亚控股有限公司（Virgin Australia Holdings Ltd.）在公布全年盈利大幅增长后表示，航班预订情况保持良好。【原文：Virgin Australia Holdings Ltd. said flight bookings are holding up after it reported a jump in full-year earnings.】

item.title: 经济乐观情绪升温，中国推动人民币升值
item.description: 随着经济前景的改善，中国央行正在推高人民币汇率，这引发了人们对其战略发生微妙转变的猜测，即倾向于更强劲的汇率。【原文：China’s central bank is nudging the yuan higher, stoking speculation of a subtle shift in strategy toward favoring a stronger exchange rate as the economic outlook improves.】

item.title: 贸易协议达成后日本股市有望延续创纪录涨势
item.description: 彭博社的一项调查显示，日本股市有望将牛市延续到明年，因为美国贸易协定和企业改革的推动刺激了投资者的情绪。【原文：Japanese stocks are poised to extend their bull run into next year, a Bloomberg survey shows, as a US trade agreement and a corporate reform drive stoke investor sentiment.】
